page.title: 08 Aldridge Fire Station
page.content: Aldridge Fire Station covers the area from Chasewater, on one side, to Walsall on the other. One fire engine is on permanent alert and will leave the station 30 seconds after the emergency call is made. Fire engines take precedence on the road in an emergency and travel at speeds above the legal limit, driving through traffic lights if necessary. Aldridge Fire Station receives about 1,000 calls to attend fires in a year, but also receives calls to rescue trapped animals or children. Hoax calls are made also which create a danger as a serious emergency could arise while the hoax call is being investigated. A variety of extinguishers are used depending on the fire. Oil, diesel and petrol fires are fought with foam, carbon dioxide for electric fires and water jets for many types of fire.
